job_title: Resident Care Coordinator in Hartville, OH
pros: Rewarding work, feels like your part of a big family!
You get bonuses, family medical, life insurance, and 401k
cons: Management needs work and residents can be a handful

review_title: Company is headed in the wrong direction.
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Clients are amazing. You’ll smile everyday.
cons: COO running company into the ground! $ before individual care.

job_title: Qualified Intellectual Disabilities Professional in Hartville, OH
pros: The job at it's core was one of the best jobs I've ever had. Rewarding, engaging, and fun.
cons: The organization is not supportive to their employees. They expect people to take on several sets of responsibilities, work off the clock, and put the company's image above ethics and Medicaid guidelines.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Akron, OH
pros: Care about their employees. Great work environment
cons: Nothing negative to say about this company

pros: The residents were so sweet and made my job enjoyable.
cons: This is for the Homestead not the Meadows. The management is incompetent and unorganized. The nurses and aids lack communication. The aids on first shift are rude and think they’re “above” you and try to boss you around. I’ve worked in two other nursing home facilities and this has been by far the worst. I would not recommend working there. Also the pay sucks! And the aids would take pictures in the residents room in the mirror or snapchat. Don’t have a activities director, so you have to find activities to do with them.

job_title: Resident Care Coordinator in Hartville, OH
pros: The best residents ever, very loved and cared for.
cons: Upper management policies treat there employees like kids.
